intro: Hieracium enanderi, commonly known as the Enander's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium enanderi is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments.
